intro: Ligusticum elegans, commonly known as Chinese lovage, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels, typical of the family. Its rhizomes and roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Ligusticum elegans thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
